instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message:
This <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> board had extensive liquid damage, mostly in the USB-C and speaker circuitry area. I replaced several corroded components and restored some vias.

Now this board is at 20V USB-C, starting up, and functioning well, with the exception of USB-C data: any external USB drives are powered but not recognized. However, the startup manager (option key during restart) does recognize the external drives.

Where to start trying to restore full USB data functionality?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: Replace USB redriver; the small chip which doesn't appear on the schematic/boardview.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message:
After poking around, I found that several protection diodes on USB data lines (<DIODE>D3306</DIODE>, <DIODE>D3310</DIODE>, <DIODE>D3314</DIODE>) were blown off the board. I traced these to shorts to ground on these lines:

<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_D2R_N</SIGNAL><1>, <SIGNAL>USBC_XA_D2R_N</SIGNAL><2>
<SIGNAL>USBC_XA_D2R_P</SIGNAL><1>, <SIGNAL>USBC_XA_D2R_P</SIGNAL><2>
<SIGNAL>USBC_XB_D2R_N</SIGNAL><1>, <SIGNAL>USBC_XB_R2D_C_N</SIGNAL><1>

These are only connected to the USB data controller <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>. Removing <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> removed the shorts. 
Replace <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and the redriver chip?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message:
USB ports should work in basic mode, if redriver chip is good.
<CHIP>U2800</CHIP> is needed only for thunderbolt options; like video out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: Ok, I removed <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> for now. The redriver chip (PI3USB32) showed some minor corrosion, so I replaced it from a donor board. However, the situation is unchanged: external drives are only recognized during startup but not when OS is loaded.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: Compare the behavior of USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 devices.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message:
Neither is recognized. I'd be happy getting USB 2.0 to work. 

From the USB-C connector pinout, I understand that I need the center pins (D+, D-) to work, correct? They connect to the CD3215s via <SIGNAL>USBC_XA_USB_TOP_N</SIGNAL> and similar lines. What else needs to be working to establish functional USB 2.0 communication?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: The issue may be related with <CHIP>U2800</CHIP>, as it appears only when macOS starts to load the drivers.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> has been off the board for all tests since you stated that it is only needed for data such as video out.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> MacBook Pro 2017 board with USB data line issues
threads.message: Seems that macOS needs it in fact...
